abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Guangxi Highway Project
            for China were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the
            risk to development outcome was low or negligible, Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower performance
            was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: site
            investigations should be comprehensive and detailed to
            minimize inconsistencies between construction drawings and
            field conditions. Contract variations would have been
            minimized if designs and technical specifications had been
            subjected to closer and more rigorous examination and
            review. Planning and design of interchanges and
            administrative and maintenance facilities warranted careful
            consideration before contracts were awarded. Close
            supervision by the supervising consultants focused on
            carefully selected sites in the field paid dividends in
            terms of ensuring quality and timely completion of work. The
            cash deposit of 2 percent of contract sum required of
            contractors ensured that environmental safeguard measures
            contained in civil works contracts will be carefully
            executed. Technical studies providing assistance and
            solutions to specific problems encountered in project
            implementation were well received and appreciated by the
            implementing entity.

5086170.trustfund: TF037398-CHINA - GUANGXI PROV. HWY,TF039334-CHINA - GUANGXI HIGHWAY PROJECT
5086170.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Rural development,Urban development

abstracts.cdata!:
The Guangxi Highway Project in China,
            will provide cost-effective inter-provincial transport links
            among land-locked provinces, and stimulate economic
            development, reduce poverty, and thus reduce regional
            disparities. The components include: 1) expansion of the
            highway capacity, through partial construction of the
            National Trunk Highway System, connecting the Shuiren, and
            Nanning provinces, as well as those roads connecting into
            the corridor; 2) maintenance and rehabilitation of the
            highway system is included, particularly for those rural
            roads, in relatively poor areas; 3) highway safety will be
            improved, through the upgrade of the most dangerous road
            sections in sub-urban areas of the Nanning, and Wuming
            provinces, and other selected road segments; and, 4) the
            Guangxi Communications Department's capacity will be
            strengthened, through support, and training on project
            planning, design, construction, and supervision. Further
            support is included for project management, and monitoring
            of environmental, and resettlement plans.

439176.trustfund: TF039334-CHINA - GUANGXI HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF037398-CHINA - GUANGXI PROV. HWY

repnme.cdata!:
China - Guangxi Highway Project :
            environmental impact assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Guangxi Highway
            Project is to assist the Guangxi government to strengthen
            the local institutional capacity, and provide an efficient,
            safe and cost effective inter-provincial transport link
            among land-locked hinterland provinces of Guizhou, Yunnan,
            Sichuan and the city of Chongqing with Guangxi and the
            coastal province of Guangdong. During construction of the
            roads, noise pollution will be mitigated by resettlement,
            installation of noise barriers, and afforestation. To
            protect the landscape, detail alignment will be determined
            to minimize spots, volumes and areas of cutting limestone
            mountains. Restoration of vegetations will take place on all
            cutting sites. All plantable cutting slopes will be covered
            with turf. Because of the fact that the alignment goes along
            hilly and high areas with well developed vegetation, the
            construction will not have significant impact on the
            ecosystem along the road. Trees and grasses will be planted
            in the side slopes to reduce soil erosion. Temporary earth
            settlement tanks will be dug to catch runoff from
            excavation. To mitigate the impact of water pollution,
            sewerage treatment facilities will be set up at the service
            areas and toll stations. Culverts will be constructed for
            irrigation. To reduce air pollution, construction sites will
            be sprayed regularly. Wastewater will be treated and oil
            leakage from machinery will be collected and recycled.

docna.cdata!:
China - Guangxi Highway Project :
            environmental impact assessment

display_title.display_title:
China - Guangxi Highway Project :
            environmental impact assessment (Vol. 3)

438975.trustfund: TF039334-CHINA - GUANGXI HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF037398-CHINA - GUANGXI PROV. HWY

repnme.cdata!:
China - Guangxi Highway Project :
            environmental impact assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Guangxi Highway
            Project is to assist the Guangxi government to strengthen
            the local institutional capacity, and provide an efficient,
            safe and cost effective inter-provincial transport link
            among land-locked hinterland provinces of Guizhou, Yunnan,
            Sichuan and the city of Chongqing with Guangxi and the
            coastal province of Guangdong. During construction of the
            roads, noise pollution will be mitigated by resettlement,
            installation of noise barriers, and afforestation. To
            protect the landscape, detail alignment will be determined
            to minimize spots, volumes and areas of cutting limestone
            mountains. Restoration of vegetations will take place on all
            cutting sites. All plantable cutting slopes will be covered
            with turf. Because of the fact that the alignment goes along
            hilly and high areas with well developed vegetation, the
            construction will not have significant impact on the
            ecosystem along the road. Trees and grasses will be planted
            in the side slopes to reduce soil erosion. Temporary earth
            settlement tanks will be dug to catch runoff from
            excavation. To mitigate the impact of water pollution,
            sewerage treatment facilities will be set up at the service
            areas and toll stations. Culverts will be constructed for
            irrigation. To reduce air pollution, construction sites will
            be sprayed regularly. Wastewater will be treated and oil
            leakage from machinery will be collected and recycled.
